DOC.brief_summary: The study will assess the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of providing brief, intensive case management for frequent users of hospital Emergency Departments who have mental health and/or addictions problems. The goals of the intervention are to support patients' transition to community-based health and social services and supports - including primary and urgent psychiatric care, peer support and other community services and supports - so as to improve patient wellbeing and reduce avoidable ED visits and hospitalizations.
DOC.brief_title: Coordinated Access to Care From Hospital Emergency Departments
DOC.criteria: legal adult status (age 18) able to give informed consent have made 5+ visits to participating hospital Emergency Department in the previous 12 months One of these visits will have been for a mental health and/or addiction problem.
